p: In a case study by Jacoby et al., 2002, it was discussed that influenza virus infection may cause an increase in airway inflammation and bronchoconstriction, particularly during asthma attacks. Inflammatory mediators, which are produced by epithelial cells and increase in response to influenza virus infection, include IL-6 and IL-8, regulated on activation, normal T lymphocytes expressed (RANTES), eotaxin, oxygen radicals, and antioxidant enzymes [ 51].
